_description: Ground truth annotations for 10 benchmark PDFs. Combines content/structural annotations with metadata accuracy ground truth. All metadata fields have been human-verified against the original PDFs.

_fields.title: Exact document title as it appears on the first page
_fields.authors: Ordered list of author names or organisations, exactly as credited
_fields.doi: DOI string without URL prefix (null if none)
_fields.publication_date: ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD) or partial (YYYY-MM or YYYY)
_fields.source: Journal name, publisher, or issuing organisation
_fields.abstract_first_sentence: First sentence of the abstract, used for content-presence fuzzy matching
_fields.keywords: Author-provided keywords as a single raw string, exactly as printed in the PDF (null if none listed)
_fields.has_references: Whether the document has a references/bibliography section
_fields.num_tables: Number of data tables in the document
_fields.key_passage: A distinctive passage used for content-presence verification
_fields.key_passage_page: Page number where the key passage appears
_fields.sections_in_order: Expected markdown heading order (for section-order scoring)
_fields.continuity_passages: Passages spanning page/column breaks (for continuity testing)

_evaluation_notes: Content presence: title/authors/key_passage use fuzzy matching (threshold 0.70), abstract uses first-sentence fuzzy match. Metadata accuracy: title uses normalised string similarity (>0.90), authors checks recall/precision of names, date checks year match, DOI is exact match, abstract uses first-sentence fuzzy match, keywords normalises separators (comma, pipe, semicolon) then checks set overlap.

1-s2.0-S2352250X23001574-main.pdf.abstract_first_sentence: This paper reviews correction effectiveness, highlighting which factors matter, which do not, and where further research is needed.

continuity_passages.text: For example, interventions such as accuracy prompts and social norms use a nudging approach, interventions involving media-literacy training aim to boost misinformation detection, and warning labels or corrections debunk misinformation (see Ref. [8]). This brief review focuses on this last approach, the effective correction of misinformation.
